title: [K-12] Project-Based Learning Course for Systematic Language Education Design for Pre-Service Adult Teachers: Integrated Listening·Speaking·Reading·Writing Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational language education theories (grammar systems, vocabulary expansion strategies, text analysis methods), classroom management experience, digital tool proficiency, and experience with language learning apps
context.additional_context: Emphasizes designing field-applicable language education in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Focuses on developing activity designs and assessment tools to improve learners' expression and reading comprehension skills. Particularly concentrates on cultivating context-based language use abilities through grammar structure analysis and vocabulary expansion strategies.

learning_goals: Learners can structure integrated listening, speaking, reading, and writing activities using a language education design framework reflecting real elementary classroom environments, systematically applying text analysis and expression strategies

Learners can produce project outcomes reflecting industry-linked curriculum requirements and lifelong learning competencies, while integrating activities such as grammatical structure analysis, vocabulary expansion strategies, and context-based sentence construction.

Learners can design a one-week learning plan using three or more language-learning apps (e.g., Duolingo, Memrise) in a smartphone environment, incorporating vocabulary memorization, pronunciation practice, and sentence construction. They can demonstrate feasibility and pedagogical effectiveness through peer evaluation and a teacher-verified checklist (meeting at least three of five criteria) and propose strategies to enhance reading comprehension and expressive skills.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
